intro: Minuartia rupestris, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a low-growing perennial plant native to rocky and arid environments. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh conditions, often thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its flowers typically bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and flies. Minuartia rupestris is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its hardy nature and ornamental value.
